meanings.definition: Not skilled or proficient; clumsy or inept.
meanings.sent1: The new student was unadept at solving math problems.
meanings.sent2: She felt unadept at playing the piano compared to her talented sister.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, his unadept attempts at juggling always ended in chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her unadept navigation skills left her lost in the unfamiliar city.
meanings.sent5: The unadept painter's brushstrokes lacked finesse and precision.

meanings.definition: Lacking skill or expertise; unskilled or untrained.
meanings.sent1: The unadept chef burned the dinner for the third time this week.
meanings.sent2: He felt unadept at fixing the leaky faucet without any prior experience.
meanings.sent3: The unadept gardener accidentally planted flowers in the vegetable patch.
meanings.sent4: Her unadept driving skills made her nervous behind the wheel.
meanings.sent5: The unadept carpenter struggled to build a simple bookshelf.
